item.title: Pro Cache Editing [UPDATED]
item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

[quote=“Halflingblade, post:19, topic:388858”][quote author=zyle1992 link=topic=484677.msg3552154#msg3552154 date=1301614761]

Thats the wrong way to do it, if you do it that way it requires the server to load the textures from the client which creates lag and more problems. The way I’m doing it makes it so the client loads the textures and no work is required from the server. And no I’m not wrong, what I’m doing requires a lot more than adding a texture into the cache, this way you can add textures into an area without over writing the same textures in every other area. If you knew anything about using the program I’m using you wouldn’t be telling me I’m wrong.

Why the hell would anyone be loading textures from the server? That’s just fucking retarded, and I don’t know of ANY implementation that does this. As for your comment about overwriting textures in every other area, you obviously have no idea what you’re talking about. A simple edit of the flo.dat(floor) file in the cache can do exactly what you’re doing. All you have to do is find the tile that you’re interested in editing, change the texture id of that tile and boom, you’re done. As asshole_rule said

a fucking monkey could do this. You’re not hot shit because you can change a texture.

And also, you’re using a program to do this. More than likely you have no idea of the inner workings of the cache, nor how it’s read from/written to. This thread would be the equivalent of me typing up a Word document using different fonts/colors etc, and asking the community how I did.
[/quote]

I’m not loading textures from the server, thats what he wanted me to do. Now if your dumbass could read correctly before you post stupid shit maybe you would sound smart. Obviously you have no idea why I made this thread, and I asked how I did I didn’t ask for some dumbass remark telling me its not hard to do. I know its not a hard thing to do, that wasn’t the fucking point. Now if you’d excuse me I’m going to work on my server base and then show my development, maybe then you dumbasses wouldn’t post a dumb reply saying this isn’t hard.[/quote]

rofl zyle said nothing in his post about loading a texture through the server, it is you who needs to read more carefully.

and btw, stuff like this was accomplished 3 or more years ago, so i dont see what the importance of this is.

Read full topic

If you knew anything about using the program I’m using you wouldn’t be telling me I’m wrong.

As for your comment about overwriting textures in every other area, you obviously have no idea what you’re talking about. A simple edit of the flo.dat(floor) file in the cache can do exactly what you’re doing. All you have to do is find the tile that you’re interested in editing, change the texture id of that tile and boom, you’re done. As asshole_rule said

a fucking monkey could do this. You’re not hot shit because you can change a texture.

And also, you’re using a program to do this. More than likely you have no idea of the inner workings of the cache, nor how it’s read from/written to. This thread would be the equivalent of me typing up a Word document using different fonts/colors etc, and asking the community how I did.

I’m not loading textures from the server, thats what he wanted me to do. Now if your dumbass could read correctly before you post stupid shit maybe you would sound smart. Obviously you have no idea why I made this thread, and I asked how I did I didn’t ask for some dumbass remark telling me its not hard to do. I know its not a hard thing to do, that wasn’t the fucking point. Now if you’d excuse me I’m going to work on my server base and then show my development, maybe then you dumbasses wouldn’t post a dumb reply saying this isn’t hard.
[/quote]

You obviously lack the mental capacity to realize when you’re wrong.

Also, I believe this belongs in the Client Development Section.[/quote]

LOL, you need to get your head checked kid. Also, the client development section only has client help, and client hacking, and last time I posted something like this in client development everyone told me it was the wrong place to post this type of thread. So go fuck yourself.

Read full topic

The way I’m doing it makes it so the client loads the textures and no work is required from the server. item.title: Pro Cache Editing [UPDATED]
item.dc:creator: @LilXCj LilXCj
item.description:
@LilXCj wrote:

[quote=“asshole_rule, post:15, topic:388858”][quote author=Halflingblade link=topic=484677.msg3551999#msg3551999 date=1301608910]

Not even worth a server development tbh.

This is a client development dumbass, and it happens to be a great thing if you want your server to look better.
[/quote]

Your false sense of arrogance makes me mad. My point was this isn’t worth a development, a fucking monkey could do this. You’re not hot shit because you can change a texture.

EDIT: This is like me editing a sprite in the cache, freaking out then making a thread about it.[/quote]

Fuck you.

[quote=“zyle1992, post:14, topic:388858”][quote author=Halflingblade link=topic=484677.msg3552042#msg3552042 date=1301610593]

So you changed the textures of the ground?

Yes and soon to be objects/walls/etc.

That’s not “Pro Cache Editing”. That’s simply changing one number/image.

Actually you’re wrong. Theres no changing numbers or images involved, this has to do with a lot of different things including colors, shapes, sizes, heights, and a lot more. And the reason I called it “Pro Cache Editing” is because I used “Pro Cache Editor” to edit it.
[/quote]

Actually you’re wrong. If you’re doing all that to change one texture, you’re doing it wrong. The MOST you have to do is add a texture entry into the cache, and then in client do

if(textureId == oldTexture) { textureId = newTexture; } [/quote]

and you.

Packing a cache to load the texture is better instead of asking the client to look if this texture is being used, then change it to another texture if it is.

Asshole, your arrogance is what makes other countries portray Americans as stupid. Remove yourself from the gene pool. The meaning of development is developing something that is different from the original product. As far as whether you think its development and going backwards, is simply opinion.

Ontopic: As far as I can tell, you’re creating an original home area. If you’re doing that, make sure to keep things blended well and keep things such as portals or ships (to move players to other islands/areas) close together without having to move far away.

Read full topic

item.title: Pro Cache Editing [UPDATED]
item.dc:creator: @Halflingblade Halflingblade
item.description:
@Halflingblade wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:14, topic:388858”][quote author=Halflingblade link=topic=484677.msg3552042#msg3552042 date=1301610593]

So you changed the textures of the ground?

Yes and soon to be objects/walls/etc.

That’s not “Pro Cache Editing”. That’s simply changing one number/image.

Actually you’re wrong. Theres no changing numbers or images involved, this has to do with a lot of different things including colors, shapes, sizes, heights, and a lot more. And the reason I called it “Pro Cache Editing” is because I used “Pro Cache Editor” to edit it.
[/quote]

Actually you’re wrong. If you’re doing all that to change one texture, you’re doing it wrong. The MOST you have to do is add a texture entry into the cache, and then in client do

if(textureId == oldTexture) { textureId = newTexture; } [/quote]

Thats the wrong way to do it, if you do it that way it requires the server to load the textures from the client which creates lag and more problems. The way I’m doing it makes it so the client loads the textures and no work is required from the server. And no I’m not wrong, what I’m doing requires a lot more than adding a texture into the cache, this way you can add textures into an area without over writing the same textures in every other area. If you knew anything about using the program I’m using you wouldn’t be telling me I’m wrong.

Your false sense of arrogance makes me mad. My point was this isn't worth a development, a fucking monkey could do this. You're not hot shit because you can change a texture.

EDIT: This is like me editing a sprite in the cache, freaking out then making a thread about it.

The reason I made a thread about it is because I wanted to show what my textures looked like and get feedback on them so I could get ideas on what to change and what not. Obviously you have NO IDEA what these forums are meant for. I never said I was hot shit dumbass.

Read full topic

item.title: Pro Cache Editing [UPDATED]
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“Halflingblade, post:13, topic:388858”][quote author=zyle1992 link=topic=484677.msg3552034#msg3552034 date=1301610387]

So you changed the textures of the ground?

Yes and soon to be objects/walls/etc.

That’s not “Pro Cache Editing”. That’s simply changing one number/image.
[/quote]

Actually you’re wrong. Theres no changing numbers or images involved, this has to do with a lot of different things including colors, shapes, sizes, heights, and a lot more. And the reason I called it “Pro Cache Editing” is because I used “Pro Cache Editor” to edit it.[/quote]

Actually you’re wrong. If you’re doing all that to change one texture, you’re doing it wrong. The MOST you have to do is add a texture entry into the cache, and then in client do

if(textureId == oldTexture) {
    textureId = newTexture;
}

item.title: Pro Cache Editing [UPDATED]
item.dc:creator: @Halflingblade Halflingblade
item.description:
@Halflingblade wrote:

Ix Soulcist xI:

The Elf brick floors look a lot better than the pebble stone floors. The floors don’t look that bad, and the rest of the areas. What is the point of this development though, just the textures or something?

Well, I’m trying to update the look of the game, and make more room for players to roam around. The reason why I added the ponds around the bank is so players could have an area to fish in Yanille, the other area is kinda complicating. Plus I am going to regulate the ground height a little bit and make more areas to place objects etc.

Thanks for the feedback!

Read full topic
